title: IVPs fail when output tasks include redundant substitutions

content.raw:
When defining substitutions that have the square of a field quantity, as in,

```
problem.substitutions['square_sub'] = '(w)**2'
```

If you try to output that substitution’s data in BOTH coefficient and grid space,

```
slices = solver.evaluator.add_file_handler('slices', sim_dt=0.25, max_writes=50)
coeffs = solver.evaluator.add_file_handler('coeffs', sim_dt=0.25, max_writes=50)
slices.add_task('square_sub')
coeffs.add_task('square_sub', layout='c')
```

The run fails with a “ValueError: gdata does not match scaled grid\_size” before any timesteps can occur. I’ve attached a minorly modified rayleigh\_benard.py file from the dedalus examples \(my changes are lines 48 and 98-102 of the attached file\)  that reproduces this error, and an text file containing the simulation output and full traceback.

A similar bug has appeared on numerous devices within our research group, so this doesn’t seem to be isolated to my computer.
